CODIF_DATA.TD_DOCUMENT_TYPE: Prior information notice without call for competition
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Union, with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 01C01

TI_TEXT.P: Servicii de învăţământ şi formare profesională

ADDRESS_CONTRACTING_BODY.ADDRESS: Procurement Services, 4th Floor, Companies House, Crown Way

TITLE.P: HEIW Provision of Education and Training Engagement Event

SHORT_DESCR.P: The current education contracts held by Health Education and Improvement Wales with education providers expire on 31.7.2021, the renewal of which provides a significant challenge as well as opportunities for HEIW. Such a procurement for education on this scale is unprecedented and will impact on all health professional education for the next 10 years.
The contract will be divided into lots and the draft lotting strategy will be shared for discussion at the event.
Health Education and Improvement Wales are seeking to review Health Professional Education and Training within Wales.

The need to establish new contracts provides HEIW with an opportunity to consider the breadth and configuration of education provision required across Wales to deliver the health and care workforce of the future in response to A Healthier Wales including:
— the development of new flexible career pathways,
— provision of multi-professional learning,
— increased use of simulation facilities,
— delivery of education in partnership with Social Care Wales,
— provision of education locally to enable staff to learn close to home,
— providing more education in primary care,
— the development of intensive learning academic hubs.
The opportunity to renew these contracts has allowed HEIW to explore the following strategic objectives in order to add significant value to the new contracts:
— the need for inter-professional education, simulation and placement preparation to be embedded within the curriculum,
— distance learning to build digital skills in healthcare delivery and digital solutions to support students living in rural areas,
— widening access which includes lowering tariffs for a more inclusive entry,
— potential of an education consortium,
— flexibility to develop post registration education including development of a MSc and extended skills education,
— development of increasing numbers of placements within primary care, public health and social care settings, leading to a set percentage of student placements within these areas,
— centralised placement support and quality management led by HEIW,
— admissions requirements and quality monitoring measures,
— best practice from other countries.

INFO_ADD.P: The contract will be divided into lots and the draft lotting strategy will be shared for discussion at the event.

In line with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 Procurement Services and HEIW wish to hold a preliminary market consultation event prior to launching a procurement procedure for the design and delivery of Health Professional Education and Training. As such, discussions will be held with education providers prior to starting a procurement procedure, the purpose being to both inform education providers and to allow procurement services and HEIW to seek advice in the planning and conduct of the procurement procedure. Award of contract will be subject to confirmation of funding via Welsh Government.
Procurement services and HEIW will run the preliminary market consultation at the All Nations Centre, Cardiff on Friday 11th October at 10:30 a.m.

Potential bidders will be provided with further insight into the requirement and given the opportunity to ask questions. In order to help define the requirement and to develop the contract’s requirement, following the presentation/ Q and A session, potential bidders will have an opportunity to have a 1:1 with HEIW representatives (maximum 10 minute allocated slot).
Next steps — potential bidders who are interested in attending this event:
1) Are invited to express an interest to the email address below — confirming the names and positions of proposed attendees; please note that spaces are limited;
2) Please confirm if your organisation would like to book a 10-minute slot to further discuss the requirements with HEIW and procurement services.
Note: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Sell2Wales website at https://www.sell2wales.gov.wales/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=95282
